newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK Feb exports down 8.7 pct, re-exports up 2.2 pct.
newsitem.headline: HK Feb exports down 8.7 pct, re-exports up 2.2 pct.

text.p: The volume of domestic exports in February fell 8.7 percent year-on-year, while re-exports rose 2.2 percent, the Census and Statistics Department said on Thursday.
Total export volume rose 0.5 percent and import volume increased by 8.5 percent, it said in a statement.
Volume of domestic exports for the first two months of 1997 decreased by 8.0 percent while volume of re-exports leapt 2.4 percent. Total exports rose 0.8 percent and imports grew by 5.4 percent.
Prices of domestic exports were down 2.1 percent in February from a year earlier and re-export prices decreased by 1.5 percent. Import prices fell 2.6 percent.
Prices of domestic exports for the first two months of 1997 were 1.9 percent lower, while those of re-exports fell 1.4 percent. Import prices dropped 2.4 percent.

The department said prices are based on unit values which do not take into account changes in the composition or quality of goods traded, except for some selected commodities for which specific price indices are available.
